title: G.I. Joe goes triple-A with new game headed by ex-WB developers
content:
Consider this a public service announcement big enough for Flint, Gung-Ho, and Alpine to host: G.I. Joe, one of the United States' longest-running comic and cartoon series, appears to finally be on the verge of returning to console video games in a major way.

Magic: The Gathering creators Wizards of the Coast are making a new game in the franchise with ex-WB Games developersâ€”the first project for a new, as-yet-unnamed triple-A studio. As listed in multiple job posts on its career page, the company is looking to fill positions at the development house, currently called "New Raleigh-Durham Studio," for a multiplatform third-person action game set "in the G.I. Joe universe."

Wizards, a division of Hasbro (which also owns the G.I. Joe brand), states the developer is being headed by experienced ex-staffers from WB Games and other major studios, though the listings suggest it's still recruiting for some senior positions, including lead game designer and art director.
